opener noun
(FIRST)
a person, event, etc. that is the first in a series of similar things or prepares for what follows: England's opener with Portugal will be live on TV. Caesar salad is a great opener for a romantic Italian meal. Album opener "The New Year" is an anti-holiday classic.
[ usually plural ] the performer or band (= group of musicians) that performs before the main one in a concert or other performance : After years of being the openers, the band will headline its next series of concerts. In June 1979, the Misfits performed as openers for The Damned in New York City. for openers informal
first: Just for openers, I'd like to ask a question.

opener noun
(SPORTS PLAYER)
in cricket, one of the two batters (= the players who try to hit the ball) who start the turn of the team to hit the ball: He has the ideal temperament for a Test match opener: calm and watchful. The openers put on 82 for the first wicket.
in baseball, a pitcher who throws for a short time at the start of a game before being replaced by the team's main pitcher: The opener will be expected to pitch one or two innings. The Brewers used a left-hander as an opener to pitch to three batters.
